p: Fever, cough, and shortness of breath were the most common clinical signs observed in 50%, 30.43%, and 23.91% of the bacterial cases, in 75%, 78.13%, and 34.38% of the viral cases, in 60%, 35%, and 40% of the Yeast cases, and 64%, 68% and 44% of the co-infections cases, respectively. The bacterial group was significantly different from the viral group and the co-infected group in cough ( p＜0.0083), at the same time, the viral group and the Yeast group in cough also has significant differences( p＜0.0083) ( Table 2 ).
